metadata.title: Translating old drugs into new treatments: ribosomal frameshifting as a target for antiviral agents

abstract.original_text: Programmed ribosomal frameshifting is used by many viruses to regulate the production of structural and enzymatic proteins.

sentences.segment_text: Programmed ribosomal frameshifting is used by many viruses to regulate the production of structural and enzymatic proteins .

abstract.original_text: Altering the frameshifting efficiencies disrupts the virus life cycle and eliminates or reduces virus production. Ribosomal frameshifting therefore provides a unique target on which antiviral agents can function. This article describes a series of rapid assay strategies that have been developed and used to identify potential antiviral agents that target programmed Ϫ1 ribosomal frameshifting.

sentences.segment_text: Altering the frameshifting efficiencies disrupts the virus life cycle and eliminates or reduces virus production .
